Name: Repealing section 19-163.2 of such code, relating to limiting the use of adhesive stickers on motor vehicles to enforce alternate side parking rules.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to repealing section 19-163.2 of such code, relating to limiting the use of adhesive stickers on motor vehicles to enforce alternate side parking rules

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

Summary: This bill would repeal the 2012 local law that barred the New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) and Department of Sanitation (DSNY) from placing stickers on motor vehicles as a method of enforcing alternate side parking rules.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Section 19-163.2 of the administrative code of the city of New York is REPEALED.
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
